text: I have a class as follows:

code:
class X:
    def __init__(self):
          self.sum_x =0.0
          self.sum_x_squared=0.0
          self.var_x =0.0
          self.sum_y =0.0
          self.sum_y_squared=0.0
          self.var_y =0.0

    def update(self,data):
         [x,y,vx,vy]=data
         self.update_sums(self.sum_x,self.sum_x_squared,x)
         self.update_sums(self.sum_y,self.sum_y_squared,y)
         .


    def update_sums(self,sums,squares,val):
          sums += val
          squares += val*val
          .

text: I would like to pass the member variables sum_x, sum_x_squared etc to the update_sums function for update how do I do this, I am confused.
